title: Classic Children's Books
description: How well do you remember these beloved children's books from the 1930s through the 1980s?

questions.question: In 'Charlotte's Web' (1952), what type of animal is Charlotte?
questions.explanation: Charlotte is a grey spider who befriends Wilbur the pig and saves his life by writing words in her web.

questions.question: What does the Very Hungry Caterpillar eat on Saturday in Eric Carle's 1969 classic?
questions.explanation: On Saturday, the Very Hungry Caterpillar eats through a massive feast of junk food including cake, ice cream, and sausage.

questions.question: In 'The Cat in the Hat' (1957), what are the names of the Cat's two helpers?
questions.explanation: Thing One and Thing Two are the mischievous creatures who emerge from a red box and cause chaos.

questions.question: Who wrote 'Where the Wild Things Are' (1963)?
questions.explanation: Maurice Sendak wrote and illustrated this beloved tale of Max and his journey to the land of the Wild Things.

questions.question: In 'Curious George' (1941), who captures George and brings him to the big city?
options: The Man in the Yellow Hat
questions.explanation: The Man in the Yellow Hat captures George in Africa and brings him to live in the city.

questions.question: What is the name of the chocolate factory owner in Roald Dahl's 1964 novel?
questions.explanation: Willy Wonka is the eccentric candy maker who invites five children to tour his magical chocolate factory.

questions.question: In 'Goodnight Moon' (1947), what color is the great room?
questions.explanation: The 'great green room' is the iconic setting where the bunny says goodnight to everything around the room.

questions.question: What type of animal is Babar, the star of Jean de Brunhoff's 1931 book?
questions.explanation: Babar is a young elephant who travels to the city, becomes educated, and returns to become king of the elephants.

questions.question: In 'The Giving Tree' (1964) by Shel Silverstein, what does the tree give the boy last?
questions.explanation: After giving away her apples, branches, and trunk, the old stump offers itself as a place for the old man to sit.

questions.question: Which classic 1939 children's book features a shy little bunny who keeps running away from his mother?
questions.explanation: 'The Runaway Bunny' by Margaret Wise Brown tells of a little bunny who imagines running away, only for his mother to follow.

questions.question: In 'Madeline' (1939), in which city does Madeline live with the other girls?
questions.explanation: Madeline lives in an old house in Paris that is covered with vines, with eleven other little girls in two straight lines.

questions.question: What kind of creature is Winnie-the-Pooh's friend Eeyore?
questions.explanation: Eeyore is a gloomy grey donkey who is always losing his tail in A.A. Milne's beloved stories.

questions.question: In 'James and the Giant Peach' (1961), what makes the peach grow to enormous size?
questions.explanation: A mysterious old man gives James magical glowing green crocodile tongues that cause the peach to grow gigantic.

questions.question: What is the name of the spider in 'James and the Giant Peach'?
questions.explanation: Miss Spider is one of the insect companions who lives inside the giant peach with James.

questions.question: In 'The Phantom Tollbooth' (1961), what is the name of the bored boy who enters a magical land?
questions.explanation: Milo is the bored boy who drives through a magical tollbooth and enters the Lands Beyond.
